p: Buruli ulcer. Of the estimated 7,000 cases of Buruli ulcer reported annually [38], more than 4,000 cases occur in SSA ( Table 2), with the largest number reported from the West African countries of Cote d'Ivoire (approximately 2,000 cases) and Benin and Ghana (reporting approximately 1,000 cases each) ( Table 3) [37]. The greatest risk factors for acquiring Buruli ulcer include residing in an endemic area, close proximity to specific bodies of water, and age less than 15 years [37], [38].
